details.title: Democratic duty before official duty
details.content: A police constable casts her vote before starting her police duty in Thathamangalam near Manachanallur in Tiruchy on Monday. (Photo | EPS/M K Ashok Kumar)

details.title: Voter turnout at 9 AM
details.content:
• 7.29% polling recorded in Thanjavur district
  • 8.12 % polling recorded in Madurai district
  • 10.95 % polling recorded in Nagapattinam district
  • 11.2% polling recorded in Virudhunagar district
  • 11. 21 % polling recorded in Krishnagiri district
  • 14.16% polling recorded in Ramanathapuram district

details.title: Villagers boycott poll
details.content: A poll booth holds a deserted look after a section of voters threatened to boycott polls in Valaiyur village, Tiruchy. (Photo | ESP /M K Ashok Kumar)

details.title: 10 per cent voting in two hours
details.content: Tamil Nadu State Election Commission: Till 9 am, 10.41 per cent of voters have exercised their franchise during the second phase of elections to Rural Local Bodies in 27 districts

details.title: Bogus voting allegations in Madurai
details.content: Addressing the media, Madurai District Collector TG Vinay clarified that ink sealed on ballot papers was spread over to the next causing confusion over bogus votes in Ayyampatti of Sedapatti block.

details.title: Police officer dies
details.content: Police officer Johnson who was in Election duty at RT Malai in Karur district died due to heart attack.

details.title: Rice bag for vote?
Voter turnout at 11 AM
details.content: During the first four hours of polling, 25.81 per cent voter turnout in the second phase of rural local body elections in 27 districts.

details.title: Police should be here: Voters
details.content: Voters coming to Chettikulam polling booth said that they were afraid to cast votes because party-men and candidates' supporters were just 100 meters away from the booth insisting on whom to vote for and later ask whom they voted for.

details.title: Sadhguru Jaggi Vasudev votes at Mutathuvayal, Coimbatore
Perks of voting
details.content: It was a reunion for 2009 batch students of government school at Nainarkoil in Ramanathapuram district as they had come there to vote in local body election.

Observer for #LocalBodyElection in #Ramanathapuram district Atul Anand IAS visits polling station at Govt. Higher Secondary School at Nainarkoil. @xpresstn @VinodhArulappan @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/fagaugyFCQ

— 𝐋𝐚𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐡𝐚 𝐑𝐚𝐧𝐣𝐚𝐧𝐢 (@Lalitha_Ranjani) December 30, 2019

details.title: Never too old to vote
details.content: Seeniammal(96) was carried by his son to cast her vote during the second phase of rural local body elections at Villur village near Madurai on Monday. (Photo | EPS/k.k.sundar)

details.title: Check out our latest video on local body elections!
details.content: <iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/JY1nfPz4in4" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>
State Election Commission informs Madras High Court that counting of votes on January 2 will be video graphed.

details.title: Voter turnout at 1 pm
details.content:
50.09% polling in Theni district

47.97% polling in Dindigul district

40.04% polling in Coimbatore district

53.69% polling in Karur district district

51.47% polling in Pudukkottai district

Around 41 #transgenders casting their #votes at the Manavasi government middle school in #Karur during the 2nd phase of rural local body #elections#Tamilnadu #LocalBodyElection #polls@xpresstn @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/XimlObuyFK

— Aravind Raj (Airwind) (@airwindraj) December 30, 2019

details.title: Vote for rice bag!
details.content: Murugesan, candidate for Ammapatti Village Panchayat President in Sattur Union, Virudhunagar district, has given rice bags for casting vote for him.

details.title: 90+ and voting
details.content: A nonagerian and a 100-year-old lady cast their votes at Melathurb, Pudukkottai.

details.title: 90+ and voting
details.content: A nonagerian and a 100-year-old lady cast their votes at Melathurb, Pudukkottai

details.title: Counting of votes on January 2
details.content: The State Election Commission has informed the High court that the counting of the rural local body polls will happen on January 2 and it will be videographed.

details.title: 45.76 per cent votes polled in 2nd phase of local body elections till 1 PM
details.content: 45.76 p.c of voters exercised their franchise during 2nd phase of polls to Rural Local Bodies in 27 districts till 1 PM, polling ends at 5 p.m, says TN State Election Commission.

details.title: District-wise voter turnout (1 PM Update)
details.content:
Krishnagiri : 47.06%

Thoothukudi : 43.99%

Nagapattinam: 42.16%

Kanniyakumari:39.52%

Sivaganga: 42.4%

Ariyalur: 43.63%

Perambalur: 49.31%

Salem : 49.4%

Dharmapuri: 43.48%

Virudhunagar: 50.16%

Theni:50.09%

Dindigul:47.97%

Thanjavur: 44%

Tiruvarur: 57%

Ramanathapuram:52.77%

Coimbatore: 48%

details.title: Bogus voting
details.content: 36-year-old Arulanandam was allegedly denied to cast his vote as it was already cast by another person in booth 160 at Padiyanallur Village of Tiruvallur district. Officials are investigating the issue. However, the voter has left the place without voting.

details.title: Saree for vote
details.content: A flying squad arrested a man who was distributing sarees to voters near Jayankondam in Ariyalur district and seized 44 sarees from his possession.

details.title: Meet Perambalur's DiffAbled democracy enablers
details.content: (Left)A 70-year old woman casted her vote with her mentally challenged son at Nattarmangalam Panchayat Union Middle School in Perambalur district. (Right) A visually-impaired man cast his vote at Nattarmanagalm Panchayat Union Middle School in Perambalur district.

details.title: 2nd Phase: 61.45% voter turnout till 3 PM
details.content: TN State Election Commission says during the first 8 hours of polling, 61.45 per cent of voters exercised their franchise during 2nd phase of polls to Rural Local Bodies in 27 districts.

details.title: District-wise voter turnout (3 PM Update)
details.content:
Krishnagiri : 65. 48%

Salem : 64.61%

Ramanathapuram:65.65%

Virudhunagar: 63.93 %

Ariyalur: 60.41%

Perambalur: 62.92%

Tiruchy: 65.2%

details.title: Duty first, family function next
details.content: A couple taking selfie after casting their votes after a baby shower ceremony at Padalur Panchayat Union Primary School in Perambalur district.

details.title: Second phase voting ends, those already in queue allowed to cast vote
details.content: Second phase of elections to the Rural Local Bodies in Tamil Nadu have come to an end. Those who were in the queue at 5 p.m. have been given token and they can cast their votes.

details.title: One dead in Thootukudi district
details.content: One person was murdered at Ottapidaram near the polling station over election related enmity.
